Class Jenga<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Jenga<E>

  • public class Jenga<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    A data structure organised a bit like a tower of Jenga. Data is added in layers. Each layer can have 3 blocks of data. Each block has a friction constant between 1 and 10, where 10 is lots of friction. More friction makes it harder to remove a block of data, without the tower crashing down. Whether the tower will fall or not is random, but it is more likely to fall if the the stability is low, or the friction of the block is high. You are not allowed to remove a block if it is in the top 3 layers.

      • Jenga

        A new Jenga tower. By default you have 3 chances to cheat.

        A new Jenga tower.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(E e,
          int lindex)
            throws NonExistentBlockException
        Add a element to the tower.
        Parameters:
        e - The element to add to the tower.
        lindex - The layer index. The position to add it to in the layer.
        Returns:
        True is the add was successful, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        NonExistentBlockException - The layer index did not exist.

      • remove

        public E remove(int layer,
       int lindex)
         throws TowerCollapseError,
                CheatingAttemptException,
                NonExistentBlockException
        Remove a block from the tower.
        Parameters:
        layer - The index of the layer to remove from, starting with the lowest.
        lindex - The layer index for the block to remove.
        Returns:
        The data that was removed.
        Throws:
        TowerCollapseError - You have expended all your chances for cheating, or the tower was too unstable, or the friction for the chosen block was too high.
        CheatingAttemptException - You have attempted to remove a block in the first 3 layers.
        NonExistentBlockException - You have attempted to remove a block at an index that does not exit.

      • peek

        public E peek(int layer,
     int lindex)
       throws NonExistentBlockException
        Find out the data for a specific block.
        Parameters:
        layer - The index of the layer starting from the bottom.
        lindex - The index of the block.
        Returns:
        The data stored in the block.
        Throws:
        NonExistentBlockException - There is no block at the specified index.

      • friction

        public int friction(int layer,
           int lindex)
             throws NonExistentBlockException
        Find out the friction for a specific block.
        Parameters:
        layer - The index of the layer starting from the bottom.
        lindex - The index of the block.
        Returns:
        The friction value of the block. This is in the range 1..10.
        Throws:
        NonExistentBlockException - There is no block at the specified index.

        public Block getBlock(int layer,
             int lindex)
               throws NonExistentBlockException

        Parameters:

        lindex - The index of the block.
        Returns:

        Throws:
        NonExistentBlockException - There is no block at the specified index.
